title: 589.30 HEARING ON APPEAL; COSTS; PAPERS.
text: Either party in a proceeding upon a writ of habeas corpus may appeal a final order by applying to the court of appeals. The clerk of appellate courts shall serve the order fixing the time of hearing on the adverse party at least five days before the date fixed for the hearing. The hearing must be held not less than six nor more than 15 days from the date of application. No costs or disbursements may be allowed any party to the appeal, nor may any of the papers used on the hearing be required to be printed.
